Public Parking is located at 461 N. Bedford Dr. - first 2 hours free
Due to COVID-19 screening procedures, all patients must check in for screening at suite 102 before proceeding to their appointment in Suite 115 or Suite 210.
Primary & Specialty Care   8641 Wilshire Blvd.,   Beverly Hills, CA 90211
$6 - $16 Cash Only. Street & meter parking are also available.
Cancer Care   120 S. Spalding Dr., Suite 401   Beverly Hills, CA 90212   (310) 205-0771 Phone   (310) 205-0801 Fax   uclahealth.org/community-cancercare/beverly-hills

9675 Brighton Way Providers | 8641 Wilshire Blvd. Providers | Cancer Care Providers
Primary & Specialty Care - 9675 Brighton Way, Suite 100 & 102

Dr. Dinesh Chhetri is Professor of Head and Neck Surgery and a Laryngologist, a specialist in voice disorders, swallowing disorders, and airway (breathing) disorders. He graduated magna cum laude from Brown University with a degree in Biochemistry, then obtained his MD from UCLA School of Medicine, where he graduated with distinction for his thesis on vocal fold paralysis and laryngeal reinnervation. He remained at UCLA for his residency training in Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery and Fellowship in Laryngology. More >

Dr. Clare L. Coda is a board-certified physician in both Internal Medicine and Pediatrics who practices in Beverly Hills. She provides comprehensive primary and preventative care for newborns through geriatric patients, and believes in a strong partnership between patients and their physicians. More >

Andrew Louis Da Lio, MD, is the Clinical Professor and Chief in the Division of Plastic Surgery at UCLA David Geffen School of Medicine and specializes in cosmetic surgery and microsurgical breast reconstruction. Dr. Da Lio joined the faculty of the UCLA Division of Plastic & Reconstructive Surgery as an Assistant Professor in 1997. Dr. Da Lio led the division's quality assurance committee, overhauled the resident curriculum, and served as the Director of Microsurgery. In August 2011, he was named Chief of the UCLA Division of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery. More >

Dr. Delgado received her medical degree from Harvard Medical School and completed a residency in Family Medicine at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center. As a board-certified family medicine physician, she sees pediatric and adult patients. She has a special interest in academic medicine, adolescent health, gynecological care, and LGBTQ health. Dr. Delgado enjoys partnering with patients to build a comprehensive medical plan. More >

Dr. Jacob Gold is a primary care physician who practices in Beverly Hills. He is board certified in internal medicine, and is passionate about patient-centered care and evidence-based, preventive medicine. More >

Dr. Aurelia Nattiv is a family medicine and sports medicine physician with a clinical interest in osteoporosis, women's sports medicine, and stress fracture risk factors and prevention. She received her medical degree at Washington University School of Medicine and completed her residency in Family Medicine at the Sonoma County Community Hospital in Santa Rosa, California. She received her sports medicine fellowship training at the UCLA Primary Care Sports Medicine Fellowship Program. More >

Dr. Erin M. Noren is a primary care physician who practices in Beverly Hills and Santa Monica. She provides comprehensive primary care for adults, and believes in building therapeutic patient-provider partnerships. More >

Jason Roostaeian, MD, is an Associate Clinical Professor in the Division of Plastic Surgery at UCLA David Geffen School of Medicine. Dr. Roostaeian, a Los Angeles native, obtained his undergraduate degree at UCLA with summa cum laude and Phi Beta Kappa honors. He then continued at UCLA for medical school where he earned the prestigious UC Regents Scholarship, "the UC's highest recognition of academic excellence." In medical school he received Alpha Omega Alpha honors, as well as the Longmire Medial which is awarded to the top graduating student in surgery. More >
Nathan Samras, MD, MPH   Internal Medicine & Pediatrics

Dr. Nathan Samras is primary care physician who practices in Beverly Hills. He is board-certified in both pediatrics and internal medicine, and sees patients of all ages. His clinical interests include supporting parents with young children; improving the quality of care for pediatrics; tracking developmental issues in infants and toddlers; and transitioning children with special healthcare needs into adult care. More >
Maie St. John, MD, PhD   Head and Neck Surgery
Mridula Watt, MD   Internal Medicine & Pediatrics

Dr. Mridula Watt is a primary care physician who practices in Beverly Hills. She is board certified in both internal medicine and pediatrics, and sees patients of all ages. She is interested in partnering with her patients and their families to support their individual paths to wellness. More >
Pauline Yi, MD   Internal Medicine & Pediatrics

Dr. Pauline Yi is a board-certified physician and clinical instructor for the UCLA Department of Internal Medicine and Pediatrics. She practices in Beverly Hills and provides comprehensive care for both children and adults. Her clinical interests include preventive health, arthritis and joint pain, and adolescent/young adult medicine. She is fluent in Korean. More >
Primary & Specialty Care - 8641 Wilshire Blvd, Suites 102, 115 & 210

Dr. Pooya Bokhoor is a general and interventional cardiologist who practices in Santa Monica and Beverly Hills. He is board certified in internal medicine, cardiovascular disease, interventional cardiology and nuclear cardiology, and sees patients in both the clinic and the hospital. More >

Dr. Carol Cheng is dermatologist who practices in Santa Monica and Beverly Hills. She is board certified in dermatology and fellowship-trained in pediatric dermatology, and sees both adult and pediatric patients. More >

Dr. Davis received his medical degree from Drexel University in Philadelphia, and completed his internal medicine internship at the Carilion Clinic-Virginia Tech Carillion School of Medicine. He then trained in dermatology at the Case Western Reserve University School of Medicine in Cleveland, Ohio, where he served as chief resident. He earned his bachelor's and master's degrees from the University of California, Santa Barbara. More >

Dr. Ray Reza Goshtaseb is a nephrologist who practices in Santa Monica, Westwood and Beverly Hills. He diagnoses and treats patients with kidney disease, including polycystic kidney disease, diabetes with kidney disease, and anemia in kidney disease; kidney stones, kidney infections, hypertension, electrolyte abnormalities, and glomerulonephritis, among other conditions. He also helps manage the care of patients undergoing hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis. More >
John D. Fernandez, MD   Internal Medicine - Suite 210

Dr. John David (JD) Fernandez is a primary care physician who practices in Beverly Hills. His clinical interests include primary care for transgender and gender-diverse patients, the initiation and management of gender-affirming hormone treatment, transition of care for young adults into adult primary care, and adult primary care. More >
Susie Fong, MD   Sleep Medicine - Suite 210

Dr. Susie Fong is a sleep medicine physician who practices in Encino and Beverly Hills. She treats the full spectrum of sleep disorders, including sleep related breathing disorders, central disorders of hypersomnolence, circadian rhythm sleep-wake disorders, sleep related movement disorders and insomnia. More >

Dr. Pritha Gupta is a cardiologist who practices in Beverly Hills. She also sees patients in the UCLA Cardiovascular Genetics Clinic in Westwood. Dr. Gupta is board certified in internal medicine, cardiovascular disease, echocardiography and cardiac CT. Her clinic interests include women's health, cardiovascular genetics, precision medicine and preventive medicine. More >
Lillian Hsu, MD   Pulmonary & Critical Care Medicine - Suite 210

Dr. Lillian Hsu is a pulmonologist who practices in Beverly Hills. She is board certified in internal medicine, pulmonary disease and critical care medicine. Her clinical interests include asthma, COPD, pulmonary nodules and interstitial lung diseases. More >
Lisa Lin, MD   Digestive Diseases - Suite 210

Dr. Lin practices general gastroenterology, including esophageal disorders, inflammatory bowel disease and colon cancer screening. She has particular interests in gastrointestinal motility, functional gastrointestinal disorders (including irritable bowel syndrome, chronic constipation and functional dyspepsia) and fecal material transplantation. She speaks both English and Mandarin. She is a member of the American Gastroenterological Association and the American College of Gastroenterology. More >
Robert Mocharla, MD   Digestive Diseases - Suite 210

Dr. Mocharla practices general gastroenterology and hepatology with a special interest in inflammatory bowel disease, colorectal cancer screening and medical education. He is a member of the American College of Gastroenterology, American Gastroenterological Association and the Crohn's and Colitis Foundation. More >
Andrew Pham, MD   Allergy & Immunology - Suite 115
Daniel Puneky, MD   Internal Medicine - Suite 210

Dr. Daniel Puneky is a Clinical Instructor in the UCLA Department of Medicine, and an adult primary care physician in Beverly Hills. He is board certified in Internal Medicine and certified as an HIV Specialist by the American Academy of HIV Medicine. His clinical interests include care of members of the LGBTQ community, HIV primary care and prevention including PrEP and PEP, as well as preventative medicine. More >

Dr. Jien Shim specializes in general endocrinology. Her clinical interests include thyroid, parathyroid, adrenal and pituitary disorders; diabetes mellitus; transgender medicine; and obesity. She received her medical degree from Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai, where she also completed internal medicine residency training, and completed her endocrinology fellowship at UCLA. More >
Priyam Tripathi, MD   Digestive Diseases - Suite 210

Dr. Tripathi specializes in general gastroenterology with clinical interests including colon cancer screening and polypectomy, esophageal disorders including Barrett's esophagus and eosinophilic esophagitis, GERD, inflammatory bowel disease, celiac disease, hepatology, and pancreatic disease. More >

Jennifer Baker, MD, is a board-certified general surgeon. Dr. Baker completed her fellowship in breast surgical oncology at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in New York City. Dr. Baker's clinical specialties include breast cancer and breast surgical oncology; oncoplastic breast surgery; skin and nipple sparing mastectomy; sentinel lymph node biopsy and mapping; axillary lymph node dissection; locally advanced breast cancer; inflammatory breast cancer; high risk patients; BRCA mutation carriers; breast cancer in young women; male breast cancer; and benign breast conditions. More >

Dr. Solomon Hamburg is a general hematologist and medical oncologist who practices in Beverly Hills and Encino. He has been treating cancer patients for more than 40 years, and sees himself as a physician advisor, supporting each patient throughout their serious illness.

Dr. Hamburg cares for patients will all types of cancer, but has particular interest in gastrointestinal malignancies, including liver cancer; blood cancers called myeloproliferative neoplasms; and coagulation disorders. He has expertise in stem cell transplant, and is board certified in internal medicine, hematology and medical oncology. More >

Dr. Aashini Master is a hematologist oncologist who practices in Beverly Hills. She is active in the breast cancer treatment program, and is the primary physician seeing patients in the High Risk Breast Program in Santa Monica. More >

Dr. Nicholas McAndrew is a hematologist oncologist who practices in Beverly Hills and Santa Monica. His primary clinical and research interests are in breast cancer. He is board certified in internal medicine and board eligible in medical oncology and hematology. More >

Dr. Kelly McCann is a hematologist oncologist who practices in Santa Monica and Beverly Hills. She is board certified in internal medicine, hematology and medical oncology. Her clinical interests include breast cancer, gynecologic malignancies and palliative care. More >

UCLA Health is proud to serve Beverly Hills and the surrounding communities. Our Beverly Hills office on Wilshire Blvd. is a multi-specialty office consisting of general Internal Medicine and Pediatrics, as well as specialists in the following disciplines: Allergy & Immunology, Cardiology, Cardiac Imaging, Dermatology, Endocrinology, Pulmonology and Rheumatology. All of the physicians in the group are board certified in their fields.

All are UCLA Medical Group members accepting most insurances and hold faculty teaching appointments in the David Geffen School of Medicine and are on staff at UCLA Health - Santa Monica Medical Center and Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center.

We offer exemplary medical care, delivered with outstanding customer service throughout each visit, starting at the front desk. We are available to see our patients for same day appointments for illnesses.
Coordination of care for patients with chronic medical conditions and/or multiple specialist physicians
